document.title: Chemicals Involved in Decomposition
document.body:
Some content about the chemicals involved in decomposition, including enzymes, bacteria, and gases produced during the process.
Enzymes Enzymes play a crucial role in the decomposition process by breaking down complex organic molecules into simpler compounds, such as proteins into amino acids, and fats into fatty acids and glycerol.
Bacteria Bacteria are essential in decomposition, as they break down organic matter through fermentation and other metabolic processes, producing various byproducts such as carbon dioxide, ammonia, and other gases.
Gases During decomposition, gases such as carbon dioxide, methane, hydrogen sulfide, and ammonia are produced as byproducts of the breakdown of organic compounds by bacteria and other microorganisms.
